text: ਸਾਚੀ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ ਹਮ ਤੁਮ ਸਿਉ ਜੋਰੀ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I am joined in true love with You, Lord.

transliteration.text: sāchī prīt ham tum siu jōrī .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Ravidas
author.description: Saint Ravidas [1377 - 1528] was a Hindu shoemaker of the Chamar caste, who taught that a person is distinguished not by their caste, wealth or social status but instead by their actions.  Meerabai, the famous saint poetess is also said to have adopted Saint Ravidas as her Guru.

text: ਤੁਮ ਸਿਉ ਜੋਰਿ ਅਵਰ ਸੰਗਿ ਤੋਰੀ ॥੩॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I am joined with You, and I have broken with all others. ||3||

transliteration.text: tum siu jōr avar sang tōrī .3.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਜਹ ਜਹ ਜਾਉ ਤਹਾ ਤੇਰੀ ਸੇਵਾ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Wherever I go, there I serve You.

transliteration.text: jah jah jāu tahā tērī sēvā .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਤੁਮ ਸੋ ਠਾਕੁਰੁ ਅਉਰੁ ਨ ਦੇਵਾ ॥੪॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: There is no other Lord Master than You, O Divine Lord. ||4||

transliteration.text: tum sō thākur aur n dēvā .4.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਤੁਮਰੇ ਭਜਨ ਕਟਹਿ ਜਮ ਫਾਂਸਾ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Meditating, vibrating upon You, the noose of death is cut away.

transliteration.text: tumarē bhajan katah jam phānhsā .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਭਗਤਿ ਹੇਤ ਗਾਵੈ ਰਵਿਦਾਸਾ ॥੫॥੫॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: To attain devotional worship, Ravi Daas sings to You, Lord. ||5||5||

transliteration.text: bhagat hēt gāvai ravidāsā .5.5.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਜਲ ਕੀ ਭੀਤਿ ਪਵਨ ਕਾ ਥੰਭਾ ਰਕਤ ਬੁੰਦ ਕਾ ਗਾਰਾ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The body is a wall of water, supported by the pillars of air; the egg and sperm are the mortar.

transliteration.text: jal kī bhīt pavan kā thanbhā rakat bund kā gārā .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਹਾਡ ਮਾਸ ਨਾੜੀਂ ਕੋ ਪਿੰਜਰੁ ਪੰਖੀ ਬਸੈ ਬਿਚਾਰਾ ॥੧॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The framework is made up of bones, flesh and veins; the poor soul-bird dwells within it. ||1||

transliteration.text: hād mās nārīnh kō pinjar pankhī basai bichārā .1.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਪ੍ਰਾਨੀ ਕਿਆ ਮੇਰਾ ਕਿਆ ਤੇਰਾ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O mortal, what is mine, and what is yours?

transliteration.text: prānī kiā mērā kiā tērā .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. text: ਜੈਸੇ ਤਰਵਰ ਪੰਖਿ ਬਸੇਰਾ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The soul is like a bird perched upon a tree. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: jaisē taravar pankh basērā .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. text: ਰਾਖਹੁ ਕੰਧ ਉਸਾਰਹੁ ਨੀਵਾਂ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You lay the foundation and build the walls.

transliteration.text: rākhah kandh usārah nīvānh .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਸਾਢੇ ਤੀਨਿ ਹਾਥ ਤੇਰੀ ਸੀਵਾਂ ॥੨॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: But in the end, three and a half cubits will be your measured space. ||2||

transliteration.text: sādhē tīn hāth tērī sīvānh .2.

In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. text: ਬੰਕੇ ਬਾਲ ਪਾਗ ਸਿਰਿ ਡੇਰੀ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You make your hair beautiful, and wear a stylish turban on your head.

transliteration.text: bankē bāl pāg sir dērī .

In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. text: ਇਹੁ ਤਨੁ ਹੋਇਗੋ ਭਸਮ ਕੀ ਢੇਰੀ ॥੩॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: But in the end, this body shall be reduced to a pile of ashes. ||3||

transliteration.text: ih tan hōigō bhasam kī dhērī .3.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. text: ਊਚੇ ਮੰਦਰ ਸੁੰਦਰ ਨਾਰੀ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Your palaces are lofty, and your brides are beautiful.

transliteration.text: ūchē mandar sundar nārī .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. text: ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮ ਬਿਨੁ ਬਾਜੀ ਹਾਰੀ ॥੪॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: But without the Lord's Name, you shall lose the game entirely. ||4||

transliteration.text: rām nām bin bājī hārī .4.

In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. text: ਮੇਰੀ ਜਾਤਿ ਕਮੀਨੀ ਪਾਂਤਿ ਕਮੀਨੀ ਓਛਾ ਜਨਮੁ ਹਮਾਰਾ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: My social status is low, my ancestry is low, and my life is wretched.

transliteration.text: mērī jāt kamīnī pānht kamīnī ōshā janam hamārā .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. text: ਤੁਮ ਸਰਨਾਗਤਿ ਰਾਜਾ ਰਾਮ ਚੰਦ ਕਹਿ ਰਵਿਦਾਸ ਚਮਾਰਾ ॥੫॥੬॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I have come to Your Sanctuary, O Luminous Lord, my King; so says Ravi Daas, the shoemaker. ||5||6||

transliteration.text: tum saranāgat rājā rām chand kah ravidās chamārā .5.6.

text: ਚਮਰਟਾ ਗਾਂਠਿ ਨ ਜਨਈ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I am a shoemaker, but I do not know how to mend shoes.

transliteration.text: chamaratā gānhth n janaī .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਲੋਗੁ ਗਠਾਵੈ ਪਨਹੀ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: People come to me to mend their shoes. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: lōg gathāvai panahī .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. text: ਆਰ ਨਹੀ ਜਿਹ ਤੋਪਉ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I have no awl to stitch them;

transliteration.text: ār nahī jih tōpau .

In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. text: ਨਹੀ ਰਾਂਬੀ ਠਾਉ ਰੋਪਉ ॥੧॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I have no knife to patch them. ||1||

transliteration.text: nahī rānhbī thāu rōpau .1.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. text: ਲੋਗੁ ਗੰਠਿ ਗੰਠਿ ਖਰਾ ਬਿਗੂਚਾ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Mending, mending, people waste their lives and ruin themselves.

transliteration.text: lōg ganth ganth kharā bigūchā .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਹਉ ਬਿਨੁ ਗਾਂਠੇ ਜਾਇ ਪਹੂਚਾ ॥੨॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Without wasting my time mending, I have found the Lord. ||2||

transliteration.text: hau bin gānhthē jāi pahūchā .2.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Ravi Daas chants the Lord's Name;

transliteration.text: ravidās japai rām nāmā .

text: ਮੋਹਿ ਜਮ ਸਿਉ ਨਾਹੀ ਕਾਮਾ ॥੩॥੭॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: he is not concerned with the Messenger of Death. ||3||7||

transliteration.text: mōh jam siu nāhī kāmā .3.7.

text: ਰਾਗੁ ਸੋਰਠਿ ਬਾਣੀ ਭਗਤ ਭੀਖਨ ਕੀ
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Raag Sorat'h, The Word Of Devotee Bheekhan Jee:

transliteration.text: rāg sōrath bānī bhagat bhīkhan kī

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ੴ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

transliteration.text: ik ōunkār satigur prasād .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਨੈਨਹੁ ਨੀਰੁ ਬਹੈ ਤਨੁ ਖੀਨਾ ਭਏ ਕੇਸ ਦੁਧ ਵਾਨੀ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Tears well up in my eyes, my body has become weak, and my hair has become milky-white.

transliteration.text: nainah nīr bahai tan khīnā bhaē kēs dudh vānī .

In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Bhikhan
author.description:
Saint Bhikhan [1480 - 1573] is a medieval Hindu saint, two of whose hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. There are in fact two saints of that time sharing the same name - Bhakta Bhikhan and Bhikhan the Sufi. Bhakta Bhikhan was a devotee in the tradition of Saint Ravidas and Saint Dhana, born at Kakori near Lucknow in present day Uttar Pardesh. His hymns in the Guru Granth Sãhib reflect his dedication to the Name of Hari (God) which he describes as: cure for all ills of the world.

Saint Bhikhan was the most learned man of the time of Moghul Emperor Akbar. For many years, he was engaged in teaching and instructing people. He stated that this spiritual succession was from Mir Saiyid Ibrahim of Irij. He left several children who were adorned with piety, wisdom, knowledge and virtue. The hymns of Saint Bhikan resemble those of Saint Sheikh Farid.

text: ਰੂਧਾ ਕੰਠੁ ਸਬਦੁ ਨਹੀ ਉਚਰੈ ਅਬ ਕਿਆ ਕਰਹਿ ਪਰਾਨੀ ॥੧॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: My throat is tight, and I cannot utter even one word; what can I do now? I am a mere mortal. ||1||

transliteration.text: rūdhā kanth sabad nahī ucharai ab kiā karah parānī .1.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Bhikhan
author.description:
Saint Bhikhan [1480 - 1573] is a medieval Hindu saint, two of whose hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. There are in fact two saints of that time sharing the same name - Bhakta Bhikhan and Bhikhan the Sufi. Bhakta Bhikhan was a devotee in the tradition of Saint Ravidas and Saint Dhana, born at Kakori near Lucknow in present day Uttar Pardesh. He stated that this spiritual succession was from Mir Saiyid Ibrahim of Irij. He left several children who were adorned with piety, wisdom, knowledge and virtue. The hymns of Saint Bhikan resemble those of Saint Sheikh Farid.

text: ਰਾਮ ਰਾਇ ਹੋਹਿ ਬੈਦ ਬਨਵਾਰੀ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Lord, my King, Gardener of the world-garden, be my Physician,

transliteration.text: rām rāi hōh baid banavārī .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Bhikhan
author.description:
Saint Bhikhan [1480 - 1573] is a medieval Hindu saint, two of whose hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. There are in fact two saints of that time sharing the same name - Bhakta Bhikhan and Bhikhan the Sufi. The hymns of Saint Bhikan resemble those of Saint Sheikh Farid.

text: ਅਪਨੇ ਸੰਤਹ ਲੇਹੁ ਉਬਾਰੀ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: and save me, Your Saint. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: apanē santah lēh ubārī .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Bhikhan
author.description:
Saint Bhikhan [1480 - 1573] is a medieval Hindu saint, two of whose hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. There are in fact two saints of that time sharing the same name - Bhakta Bhikhan and Bhikhan the Sufi. The hymns of Saint Bhikan resemble those of Saint Sheikh Farid.

text: ਮਾਥੇ ਪੀਰ ਸਰੀਰਿ ਜਲਨਿ ਹੈ ਕਰਕ ਕਰੇਜੇ ਮਾਹੀ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: My head aches, my body is burning, and my heart is filled with anguish.

transliteration.text: māthē pīr sarīr jalan hai karak karējē māhī .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Bhikhan
author.description:
Saint Bhikhan [1480 - 1573] is a medieval Hindu saint, two of whose hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. There are in fact two saints of that time sharing the same name - Bhakta Bhikhan and Bhikhan the Sufi. text: ਐਸੀ ਬੇਦਨ ਉਪਜਿ ਖਰੀ ਭਈ ਵਾ ਕਾ ਅਉਖਧੁ ਨਾਹੀ ॥੨॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Such is the disease that has struck me; there is no medicine to cure it. ||2||

transliteration.text: aisī bēdan upaj kharī bhaī vā kā aukhadh nāhī .2.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.description:

text: ਹਰਿ ਕਾ ਨਾਮੁ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਜਲੁ ਨਿਰਮਲੁ ਇਹੁ ਅਉਖਧੁ ਜਗਿ ਸਾਰਾ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Name of the Lord, the ambrosial, immaculate water, is the best medicine in the world.

transliteration.text: har kā nām anmrit jal niramal ih aukhadh jag sārā .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.description:

text: ਗੁਰ ਪਰਸਾਦਿ ਕਹੈ ਜਨੁ ਭੀਖਨੁ ਪਾਵਉ ਮੋਖ ਦੁਆਰਾ ॥੩॥੧॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: By Guru's Grace, says servant Bheekhan, I have found the Door of Salvation. ||3||1||

transliteration.text: gur parasād kahai jan bhīkhan pāvau mōkh duārā .3.1.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Bhikhan
author.description:
Saint Bhikhan [1480 - 1573] is a medieval Hindu saint, two of whose hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. text: ਐਸਾ ਨਾਮੁ ਰਤਨੁ ਨਿਰਮੋਲਕੁ ਪੁੰਨਿ ਪਦਾਰਥੁ ਪਾਇਆ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Such is the Naam, the Name of the Lord, the invaluable jewel, the most sublime wealth, which I have found through good deeds.

transliteration.text: aisā nām ratan niramōlak punn padārath pāiā .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Bhikhan
author.description:

text: ਅਨਿਕ ਜਤਨ ਕਰਿ ਹਿਰਦੈ ਰਾਖਿਆ ਰਤਨੁ ਨ ਛਪੈ ਛਪਾਇਆ ॥੧॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: By various efforts, I have enshrined it within my heart; this jewel cannot be hidden by hiding it. ||1||

transliteration.text: anik jatan kar hiradai rākhiā ratan n shapai shapāiā .1.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.description:

text: ਹਰਿ ਗੁਨ ਕਹਤੇ ਕਹਨੁ ਨ ਜਾਈ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Glorious Praises of the Lord cannot be spoken by speaking.

transliteration.text: har gun kahatē kahan n jāī .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.description:

text: ਜੈਸੇ ਗੂੰਗੇ ਕੀ ਮਿਠਿਆਈ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: They are like the sweet candies given to a mute. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: jaisē gūngē kī mithiāī .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.description:

text: ਰਸਨਾ ਰਮਤ ਸੁਨਤ ਸੁਖੁ ਸ੍ਰਵਨਾ ਚਿਤ ਚੇਤੇ ਸੁਖੁ ਹੋਈ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The tongue speaks, the ears listen, and the mind contemplates the Lord; they find peace and comfort.

transliteration.text: rasanā ramat sunat sukh sravanā chit chētē sukh hōī .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਕਹੁ ਭੀਖਨ ਦੁਇ ਨੈਨ ਸੰਤੋਖੇ ਜਹ ਦੇਖਾਂ ਤਹ ਸੋਈ ॥੨॥੨॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Bheekhan, my eyes are content; wherever I look, there I see the Lord. ||2||2||

transliteration.text: kah bhīkhan dui nain santōkhē jah dēkhānh tah sōī .2.2.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.
